description: Try our easy to follow Rice, Silverbeet & Pine Nut Pies recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
name: Rice, Silverbeet & Pine Nut Pies Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch silverbeet, stalks removed, leaves shredded

recipeInstructions.text: Pulse flour, baking powder and margarine in a food processor until a breadcrumb consistency forms. Add 1/3 cup of the milk and pulse to a dough. Divide into 4 portions and shape into discs. Wrap in plastic. Chill for 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, prepare rice following packet directions. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and pine nuts and cook for 4 minutes or until onion has softened. Add silverbeet and 2 tbs water, cover and cook for 2 minutes or until wilted. Remove from heat, stir in rice, cheese and mint. Cool.

Preheat oven to 180Â°C. Place a baking tray into oven. Lightly grease 4 x 13cm round pie tins. Roll each pastry disc between sheets of baking paper until 3mm thick. Press into tins, trim excess and reserve. Fill with silverbeet mixture.

Re-roll reserved pastry. Cut 4 x 13cm rounds. Brush edge of pastry bases with water. Cover pies with pastry lids. Seal edges by pressing with a fork and cut a cross on top to allow steam to escape. Brush tops with remaining milk. Place onto hot tray. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden. Serve with salad.
